result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty. McMahon requesting to reschedule the 11/4/22 Hearing.  **Reviewed by Judge Dreyfus, for Branch 7, 11/2/22 - Request granted.**
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:21 AM Defendant Mackenzie W Donath in court.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Mackenzie W Donath.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Paul F. Reilly on 9/26/22.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 10:15 am.

DEFENDANT TO CO-SIGN BOND WITH HIS GUARDIAN, DEBORAH DONATH.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is to comply with all orders that come out of HHS.

1:16 PM Defendant Mackenzie W Donath, in custody, appeared by zoom video from facility.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon appeared by zoom video for Mackenzie W Donath.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant to co-sign surety bond with his guardian, Deborah Donath.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:15 am.
